lines.content: // Change this to your main class.
* The Deadline class is an extension of the base class Task.
* @param description string of the Deadline's description
* @param by LocalDateTime that represents date-time of the Deadline
* Outputs the date-time as a string in the format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm).
* @param by LocalDateTime that represents date-time of the Deadline
* @return String representation of date and time of the Deadline
* Returns a string representation of a Deadline.
* @return String representation of a Deadline with appropriate icon and description
* Returns a string representation of how a Deadline is saved in text file.
* @return String representation of a deadline in text file
* The Duke class is the main class of the entire programme.
* Loads the essential components of the entire programme.
* @param filePath name of the location in the file system
* Main function of the entire programme that controls how the whole programme will be run.
* The DukeException class is an extension of the base class Exception
* that represent exceptions specific to Duke.
* The Event class is an extension of the base class Task.
* @param description string of the Event's description
* @param at LocalDateTime that represents date-time of the Event
* Outputs the date-time as a string in the format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm).
* @param at LocalDateTime that represents date-time of the Event
* @return String representation of date and time of the Event
* Returns a string representation of an Event.
* @return String representation of an Event with appropriate icon and description
* Returns a string representation of how an Event is saved in text file.
* @return String representation of an event in text file
* The Parser class deals with making sense of the user command.
private static final DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");
* Calling out of the relevant functions according to the user's command.
* @param command String representation of the user's input
* @param ui Ui class type to be called and executed
* @param tasks TaskList class type that contains the list of data
public static void execute(String command, Ui ui, TaskList tasks) {
* Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* Constructs filePath with the specified filepath.
* @param filePath name of the location in the file system
* Loads previous tasks data from text file.
* @return A Task ArrayList containing the data from the specified text file
* @throws DukeException If the specified text file is not found
System.out.println("Error reading line in text file.");
* Saves the tasks data to a text file.
* @param tasks TaskList to obtain the tasks data from
* @throws DukeException If an error is countered while trying to save the data to the file
public void saveFile(TaskList tasks) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Error encountered when saving file.");
* The Task class is the base class for different types of tasks.
* @param description string of the Task's description
* Obtains a string icon to indicate if the task is done.
* Returns a string representation of a Task.
* @return String representation of the Task with appropriate icon and description
* Method to be called to return a string representation of how a Task is saved in text file.
* @return String representation of how the task is saved in text file
* Contains the task list, it has the operations to add/delete tasks in the list, find tasks containing a
* keyword in the list, convert tasks to their string representations.
* Constructs an empty ArrayList of type Task called tasks.
* Constructs tasks containing the elements of the specified collection.
* @param tasks the collection whose tasks are to be placed into tasks
* Returns the task at the specified position in tasks.
* @param index index of the task to return
* @return the task at the specified position in tasks
* Appends the specified task to the end of tasks.
* @param task to be appended to tasks
* Removes the task at the specified position in tasks. Shifts any subsequent task to the left.
* @param index index of the task to be removed
* Returns the number of elements in tasks.
* @return the number of elements in tasks
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @param index index of the task to be converted to string representation
* @return string representation of the specified task
* Returns a string ArrayList of description of tasks that contains the keyword.
* @param keyword String whose presence in this tasks collection is to be tested
* @return ArrayList of type String containing the string representations of the tasks containing the keyword
* The Todo class is an extension of the base class Task.
* @param description string of the Todo's description
* Returns a string representation of a Todo.
* @return String representation of a Todo with appropriate icon and description
* Returns a string representation of how a Todo is saved in text file.
* @return String representation of a Todo in text file
* The Ui class deals with interactions with the user.
* Shows a welcome message at the start of the programme.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Shows an exit message at the end of the programme.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Shows a message indicating an error encountered when loading file.
* Prints out the current tasks in the TaskList.
* @param tasks the collection whose tasks are to be printed out
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints out the tasks that contains the searched keyword.
* @param matchList the collection of string description of tasks to be printed
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Prints a message indicating that a task has been successfully added to the TaskList and
* prints out the current number of tasks at the end.
* @param task the specified task that has been successfully added
public void showAdded(Task task, TaskList tasks) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Prints a message indicating that a specified task has been marked as done.
* @param task the specified task that has been marked as done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints a message indicating that a specified task has been deleted from the collection and
* prints out the current number of tasks at the end.
* @param str description of the specified task that has been deleted
public void showDeleted(String str, TaskList tasks) {
* Prints out the current number of tasks in the collection.
* @param num number of tasks in the collection
System.out.println("Now you have " + num + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints out a message indicating that the specified field description.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! The description of an " + str + " cannot be empty.");
* Prints out a message that prompts the user to enter a valid index.
* Prints out a message indicating that the programme does not understand the user's input.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
//Create variable named ldt of type LocalDateTime (2019-08-10 23:59)
assertEquals("[D][-] geog practical (by: 2019-08-10 23:59)", new Deadline("geog practical", ldt).toString());
assertEquals("D | 0 | geog practical | 2019-08-10 23:59", new Deadline("geog practical", ldt).writeLine());
//Create variable named ldt of type LocalDateTime (2019-08-08 10:00)
assertEquals("[E][-] team meeting (at: 2019-08-08 10:00)", new Event("team meeting", ldt).toString());
assertEquals("E | 0 | team meeting | 2019-08-08 10:00", new Event("team meeting", ldt).writeLine());
assertEquals("[T][-] read geog textbook", new Todo("read geog textbook").toString());
assertEquals("T | 0 | read geog textbook", new Todo("read geog textbook").writeLine());
